p: Currently, only a handful of examples of CO 2 cleavage based on 3d metals are known (Figure 1). 8 In 2005, Sadighi et al. reported abstraction of an oxygen atom from CO 2 by NHC copper boryl complexes (NHC=N‐heterocyclic carbene), resulting in formal O atom insertion into the Cu−B bond to give compound A. 9 Subsequently, in 2007, Peters and co‐workers reported the formation of a dinuclear Fe II complex B containing bridging CO and O 2− ligands, which was prepared by reaction of CO 2 with an Fe I precursor (similar results were also published by Holland et al. shortly thereafter). 4d, 10 Recently, the group of Milstein has described a more complex CO 2 activation sequence mediated by a nickel pincer complex, involving the cleavage of a ligand C−P bond as well as one CO 2 C=O bond to give the products C and D. 11
